intro: Wahlenbergia riversdalensis, commonly known as the Riverdale bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas. It has slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
